meanings.definition: The back part of the head or skull.
meanings.sent1: She felt a bump on her occiput after hitting her head.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the occiput for any signs of injury.
meanings.sent3: The occiput seemed to have a mind of its own, always attracting attention.
meanings.sent4: His occiput was like a protective shield, guarding his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The occiput, with its smooth surface, was a distinct feature of his skull.

meanings.definition: The back of the head or skull.
meanings.sent1: He leaned back, resting his occiput against the chair.
meanings.sent2: The helmet protected his occiput during the intense game.
meanings.sent3: The occiput was the last part of the puzzle to be completed.
meanings.sent4: Her occiput felt heavy with the weight of responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The occiput, with its unique shape, was a key identifier in the forensic investigation.
